instruction: Compute the area of a selected closed curve
Calculate the volume of a closed polysurface
Measure the surface area of a Brep using RhinoCommon
code:
import Rhino.Geometry as rg
import scriptcontext as sc
import Rhino

go = Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject()
go.SetCommandPrompt("Select surface or polysurface")
go.GeometryFilter = Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectType.Brep
go.Get()
if go.CommandResult() == Rhino.Commands.Result.Success:
    brep = go.Object(0).Brep()
    amp = rg.AreaMassProperties.Compute(brep)
    if amp:
        print("Area:", amp.Area)

instruction: Find the closest point on a curve to a given point
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
curve = rs.GetObject("Select curve", 4)
if curve:
    pt = rs.GetPoint("Pick a point")
    if pt:
        param = rs.CurveClosestPoint(curve, pt)
        closest = rs.EvaluateCurve(curve, param)
        rs.AddPoint(closest)
        print("Closest point:", closest)

instruction: Find the closest point on a surface to a reference point
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
srf = rs.GetObject("Select surface", 8)
if srf:
    pt = rs.GetPoint("Pick a reference point")
    if pt:
        uv = rs.SurfaceClosestPoint(srf, pt)
        closest = rs.EvaluateSurface(srf, uv[0], uv[1])
        rs.AddPoint(closest)
        print("Closest point on surface:", closest)

instruction: Use RhinoCommon to find the closest point on a Brep
code:
import Rhino.Geometry as rg
import scriptcontext as sc
import Rhino

go = Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject()
go.SetCommandPrompt("Select brep")
go.GeometryFilter = Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectType.Brep
go.Get()
if go.CommandResult() == Rhino.Commands.Result.Success:
    brep = go.Object(0).Brep()
    test_pt = rg.Point3d(5, 5, 5)
    cp = brep.ClosestPoint(test_pt)
    if cp:
        sc.doc.Objects.AddPoint(cp)
        sc.doc.Views.Redraw()

instruction: Find intersection points between two curves
Intersect a curve with a surface and mark the intersection points
Find the intersection between two Breps using RhinoCommon
code:
import Rhino.Geometry as rg
import Rhino.Geometry.Intersect as ri
import scriptcontext as sc

# Assume brep1 and brep2 are already obtained
sphere1 = rg.Sphere(rg.Point3d(0,0,0), 5).ToBrep()
sphere2 = rg.Sphere(rg.Point3d(3,0,0), 5).ToBrep()
tol = sc.doc.ModelAbsoluteTolerance
result, curves, pts = ri.Intersection.BrepBrep(sphere1, sphere2, tol)
if result:
    for crv in curves:
        sc.doc.Objects.AddCurve(crv)
    sc.doc.Views.Redraw()
    print("Found", len(curves), "intersection curves")

import Rhino.Geometry as rg
import scriptcontext as sc

# Create a test mesh (sphere)

mesh = rg.Mesh.CreateFromSphere(sphere, 20, 20)

instruction: Evaluate the curvature of a curve at its midpoint
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
curve = rs.GetObject("Select curve", 4)
if curve:
    domain = rs.CurveDomain(curve)
    mid = (domain[0] + domain[1]) / 2.0
    curvature = rs.CurveCurvature(curve, mid)
    if curvature:
        print("Point:", curvature[0])
        print("Tangent:", curvature[1])
        print("Curvature vector:", curvature[4])
        print("Radius:", curvature[3])

instruction: Visualize curvature along a curve by placing circles at sample points
Display the surface normal at the center of a surface
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
srf = rs.GetObject("Select surface", 8)
if srf:
    domain_u = rs.SurfaceDomain(srf, 0)
    domain_v = rs.SurfaceDomain(srf, 1)
    u = (domain_u[0] + domain_u[1]) / 2
    v = (domain_v[0] + domain_v[1]) / 2
    pt = rs.EvaluateSurface(srf, u, v)
    normal = rs.SurfaceNormal(srf, (u, v))
    rs.AddLine(pt, [pt[0]+normal[0]*5, pt[1]+normal[1]*5, pt[2]+normal[2]*5])

instruction: Create normal lines at a grid of points on a surface
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
srf = rs.GetObject("Select surface", 8)
if srf:
    dom_u = rs.SurfaceDomain(srf, 0)
    dom_v = rs.SurfaceDomain(srf, 1)
    for i in range(5):
        u = dom_u[0] + (dom_u[1]-dom_u[0]) * i / 4.0
        for j in range(5):
            v = dom_v[0] + (dom_v[1]-dom_v[0]) * j / 4.0
            pt = rs.EvaluateSurface(srf, u, v)
            nrm = rs.SurfaceNormal(srf, (u, v))
            end = [pt[k] + nrm[k]*3 for k in range(3)]
            rs.AddLine(pt, end)

instruction: Evaluate a curve at equally spaced parameters and report tangent vectors
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
curve = rs.GetObject("Select curve", 4)
if curve:
    params = rs.DivideCurve(curve, 10, create_points=False)
    for t in params:
        pt = rs.EvaluateCurve(curve, t)
        tan = rs.CurveTangent(curve, t)
        print("t={:.2f} pt={} tan={}".format(t, pt, tan))

instruction: Determine if two curves are planar and coplanar
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
c1 = rs.GetObject("First curve", 4)
c2 = rs.GetObject("Second curve", 4)
if c1 and c2:
    p1 = rs.IsCurvePlanar(c1)
    p2 = rs.IsCurvePlanar(c2)
    print("Curve 1 planar:", p1)
    print("Curve 2 planar:", p2)
    if p1 and p2:
        plane1 = rs.CurvePlane(c1)
        plane2 = rs.CurvePlane(c2)
        print("Plane 1 normal:", plane1[3] if plane1 else None)
        print("Plane 2 normal:", plane2[3] if plane2 else None)

instruction: Calculate the mass properties of a mesh using RhinoCommon
code:
import Rhino.Geometry as rg
import scriptcontext as sc
import Rhino

go = Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject()
go.SetCommandPrompt("Select mesh")
go.GeometryFilter = Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectType.Mesh
go.Get()
if go.CommandResult() == Rhino.Commands.Result.Success:
    mesh = go.Object(0).Mesh()
    vmp = rg.VolumeMassProperties.Compute(mesh)
    if vmp:
        print("Volume:", vmp.Volume)
        print("Centroid:", vmp.Centroid)
